sections.title: Continue
sections.subtitle: These are working beautifully. Keep doing exactly this.
items: Your stories flow naturally and are easy to follow. Interviewers can track your thinking without getting lost.
Using specific numbers like "23% improvement" sticks in memory far longer than saying "significant impact."
Your pace is steady and grounded. That calm energy builds trust and makes you sound confident.

sections.title: Lean Into
sections.subtitle: You're already doing this well. A bit more would make it shine.
items: The payment integration story is your strongest. Use it for leadership, technical, and collaboration questions.
Naming specific tools like Kubernetes and Terraform sounds more credible than "various technologies."
Quantified outcomes are what interviewers remember when comparing candidates at the end of the day.

sections.title: Add
sections.subtitle: New elements that could elevate your answers.
items: A "lesson learned" ending shows self-awareness and growth mindset. Interviewers love candidates who reflect.
Mentioning what you'd do differently demonstrates maturity and continuous improvement. It's disarming and authentic.
Connecting your past to this role shows you've done your homework and can see yourself in their future.

sections.title: Refine
sections.subtitle: Small adjustments that could tighten your stories.
items: Your action moments are the most compelling part. Getting there faster gives you more time for the good stuff.
